title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When shutting down the system without saving a file, there is no warning dialog box displayed.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with the options 'Do you want to save your file?', 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' (which halts the shutdown).
SR:
1. Open an application and create a new file.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Attempt to shut down the system without saving the file.
4. Verify that a dialog box appears with the options to save the file ('Do you want to save your file?'), 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' (which halts the shutdown).
5. Choose different options and observe the behavior of the shutdown process.
